info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 8:43AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Bergen, northern Westchester and Rockland Counties through 930 AM EDT... At 843 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pearl River, or near Ridgewood, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New City, Ossining, Monsey, Nanuet, Ramsey, Haverstraw, Tarrytown, Nyack, Tappan, Pearl River, Hawthorne, Orangeburg, Upper Nyack, Yorktown Heights and Spring Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
